> another spirit other than a tech. The spirit that is asked for comes
> through
> in one of two ways depending on what spiritual plane that individual
> spirit resides on.
>
> I have been able to discern from communications with mike and Lisa
> that there exists
> more than one spiritual plane, the first is where our spirit awakens
> after making the
> transition from the physical. this is supposedly the only plane that
> communication with
> the physical world is capable of being sent from.
>
> When a spirit moves from this first plane to the next changes in the
> enlightenment of the spirit take place.
> The details pertaining to that are to complex to receive with our
> rudimentary equipment, evidently it can not be
> explained in short phrases or sentences. which is completely logical.
>
> To get back to the question, when a researcher asks for a spirit to
> be brought forward so they can communicate.
> The tech must locate that spirit energy and summon it to the place
> where the communication is facilitated.
> If the spirit has moved on to a higher plane of existence it must
> travel back to this lower plane to communicate.
>
> Apparently spirits that have moved up can return to the lower
> spiritual planes but spirits that have not yet
> ascended to a higher plane can not advance.
>
> I am assuming that when a spirit is called by a tech to communicate
> with the physical if it is possible it will
> journey to the communication point. If it is not possible for the
> spirit to come to that point for whatever reason
> I expect that they try to form a communication link from one point to
> another, and the tech must act as a telephone operator if you will.
>
> that is the best way I understand how to explain it, I hope it
> answers your question Ann.
>
> Bruce
